unnormalised: **Telecommunications: Fiber-to-Home Expansion Gains Momentum Across India**
normalised: **Telecommunications: Fiber-to-Home Expansion Gains Momentum Across India**

unnormalised: New Delhi, India - Leading telecom providers are aggressively expanding their Fiber-to-Home (FTTH) infrastructure across India, aiming to bridge the digital divide and cater to the growing demand for high-speed internet. Reliance Jio and Bharti Airtel are at the forefront, investing heavily in laying down new fiber optic cables, particularly in Tier-II and Tier-III cities.
normalised: New Delhi, India - Leading telecom providers are aggressively expanding their Fiber-to-Home (F T T H) infrastructure across India, aiming to bridge the digital divide and cater to the growing demand for high-speed internet. Reliance Jio and Bharti Airtel are at the forefront, investing heavily in laying down new fiber optic cables, particularly in Tier-II and Tier-III cities.

unnormalised: "Our mission is to connect every home in Bharat," stated Dr. Rajesh Kumar, CEO of Airtel Fiber, at a recent industry conference in Mumbai. "We are committed to delivering seamless connectivity, enabling access to education, healthcare, and economic opportunities."
normalised: "Our mission is to connect every home in Bharat," stated Doctor Rajesh Kumar, C E O of Airtel Fiber, at a recent industry conference in Mumbai. "We are committed to delivering seamless connectivity, enabling access to education, healthcare, and economic opportunities."

unnormalised: The initiatives include laying over 50,000 km of new fiber optic cables this fiscal year, reaching even remote villages. The expansion aims to provide speeds up to 1 Gbps, enabling services like 4K streaming, online gaming, and smart home applications. Plans also include offering affordable FTTH packages, starting from Rs. 499 per month. This is crucial for connecting homes with a large area such as 2000 sq ft with ease and high bandwidth. The investment is estimated to be several thousand crore Rupees, reflecting the commitment to establishing a robust digital infrastructure throughout the nation.
normalised: The initiatives include laying over fifty thousand kilometer of new fiber optic cables this fiscal year, reaching even remote villages. The expansion aims to provide speeds up to one G B P S, enabling services like four K streaming, online gaming, and smart home applications. Plans also include offering affordable F T T H packages, starting from rupees four hundred and ninety nine per month. This is crucial for connecting homes with a large area such as two thousand square feet with ease and high bandwidth. The investment is estimated to be several thousand crore Rupees, reflecting the commitment to establishing a robust digital infrastructure throughout the nation.
